data.title: Roll Of Honour
data.text:
​​​All Ireland and County titles only

3 x All Ireland Senior club champions 1976, 1982, 2005.

4 x Leinster Senior club champions 1976, 1982, 2004, 2005.

9 x SH county champions 1935, ‘37, 69, ‘75,76, 81, 2004, ‘05, ‘11.

1 x SH league (Matty Power Cup) 2010.

3 x SH ACHL (Byrne Cup) 1984, 1990, 2003.

4 x County Junior Hurling champions 1924, 1929, 1955, 2000.

1 x County Junior Hurling A champions 1986.

2 x County Junior Hurling B champions 1993, 2002.

1 x All County Hurling League (Hennebery Cup) 2000.

1 x Junior Hurling - Paddy Cahill Cup 1990.

7 x County U-21 hurling champions 1969, 1970, 1987, 1993, 1994, 2000, 2002.

14 x County Minor A hurling champions 1929, ‘57, ‘66, ‘68, ‘70-71, ‘82, ‘85-’86, ‘91,-

’92, ‘03, ‘12, '23.

7 x County Minor Hurling A League (John Tobin Cup) 1982, ‘85-86, ‘93, ‘97-98, 2013.

16 x County U-16 A hurling champions 1955, ‘68, ‘70, ‘74, ‘83, ‘86, ‘89, ‘91, ‘94-95,

‘96,’98, 2002-03, ‘10, ‘12.

2 x County U-16 C hurling champions 1996, 2012.

10 x County U-16 hurling League Div 1 champions 1983, ‘86, ‘89-91, 96-98, 2003, 2011.

2 x County U-16 Hurling League Div. 111 1995, 2015.

7 x U-14 Feile na Gael (Christy Ring) St. Patrick’s 1981, ‘83,

James Stephens ‘89, ‘94, ‘96, 03, ‘08.

16 x County U-14 A hurling champions St. Patrick’s 1940, ‘66-’67, ‘74, ‘81,

James Stephens 87-’89, ‘93-’94,’96, ‘99, 2000, ‘03, ‘08, ‘10.

12 x U-14 Paddy Grace Shield (County Feile) 1988-’89, ‘93-’96, ‘99-2001, ‘03, ‘08, ‘12.

1 x National Community Games St. Patrick’s 1980.

9 x Primary Schools A (St. Patrick’s) 1972,’73, ‘79, ‘85, ‘89, ‘94, ‘98, 2010, ‘11.

1 x Primary Schools C (Gaelscoil Osrai) 1998.

1 x Primary Schools D (Gaelscoil Osrai) 1997.

8 x County Senior football champions 1976, 1988, ‘91, ‘93, ‘95, ‘96, 2003, 2008.

3 x County Senior Football League 1985, 1991, 2001.

1 x County Intermediate football champions 2007.

1 x County Junior football champions 1965.

1 x Special Junior Football champions 1995.

5 x County U-21 Football champions 1986, ‘87, ‘88, ‘93, ‘94.

14 x County Minor football champions 1983, ‘85-’88, ‘90-’93, ‘96, ‘97, 2011, '17

15 x County U-16 football champions St. Patrick's (6) 1967-’70, 1974, 1979.

J S 1983-’87, ‘91, ‘93, ‘96, ‘98.

8 x County U-16 Football League 1983-’84, ‘86-’87, ‘89, ‘91-’93.

1 x All Ireland U-14 Feile Peil an nÓg Div 5 2008.

15 x County U-14 football champions St. Patrick’s 1951-’53,’72, ‘85,

James Stephens ’88-’91, ‘94, ‘96, ‘03, ‘07-’09.

James Stephens Camogie

Junior Co Champions​​2002​2020

​​​All County Junior League

​2012​​​​County Minor B Champions​1999​​​County U16B Champions​1999​​2012​​​County U14 A Champions​1999​​​County U14 B

Champions​1997

​​2004​​​CountyU14 C

Champions​1996

​2009​​

Roll of Honour Medal Winners

All-Ireland Senior Hurling

Captains of Winning Teams

Brian Cody 1982, Jackie Tyrrell 2006, Eoin Larkin 2012.

1st Club Player to play in an All-Ireland SH final

Jack Sag Carroll 1926.

Winners of All-Ireland Senior Hurling Medals

(4) Paddy Larkin 1932-‘33, ‘35, ‘39, (2) Peter Blanchfield 1935, ‘39, (1) Mick Phleep Larkin

1935, (2) Jack Sag Carroll 1932-‘33, (1) Mick Tyrrell 1936, (1) Bobby Brannigan 1939, (1) Paddy Grace 1939, (1) Paddy Shortall 1939, (5) Phil Fan Larkin 1963, 1972, 1974-‘75, 1979, (4) Liam Chunky O'Brien 1972, 1974-‘75, 1979, (4) Mick Crotty 1972, 1974-‘75, 1979, (1) Eamon Morrissey 1972, (1) Ned Byrne 1972, (3) Joe Hennessy 1979, 1982-‘83, (4) Brian Cody 1974-‘75, 1982-‘83, (4) Tom McCormack 1974-‘75, 1982-‘83, (1) Dinny McCormack 1982, (2) Paddy Neary 1982-‘83, (1) Billy Walton 1982, (3) Philip Larkin 2000, ‘02-‘03, (2) Brian McEvoy 2000, ‘02, (3) Peter Barry 2000, ‘02-‘03, (9) Jackie Tyrrell 2003, ‘06-‘09, ‘11- ‘12, 14-'15, (3) Donnacha Cody, 2006-‘08, (8) Eoin Larkin, 2006-‘09, ‘11-‘12, 14-'15, (1) Eoin McCormack ‘06, (4) Matthew Ruth 2011-‘12, 14-'15, (1) Tomás Keogh 2014, (1) Diarmuid Cody 2015.

Winners of Leinster S.H. Medals

Captains of Leinster Winning Teams

Paddy Larkin, 1936, Brian Cody, 1982, Jackie Tyrrell 2006.

Winners of Leinster SH Medals

(2) Jack Sag Carroll 1926, 1932, (9) Paddy Larkin -1931-‘33, ‘35-‘37, ‘39-‘40, ‘43, (3) Mick Larkin 1931, 1935-‘36, (7) Peter Blanchfield 1935-‘37, ‘39-‘40, ‘43, ‘45, (2) Mick Tyrrell 1936-‘37, (1) Jimmy Morrissey 1937, (2) Lar Carroll 1936-‘37, (1) Jim Dowling 1936, (1) Bobby Brannigan 1939, (1) Paddy Grace 1939, (1) Jim Larkin 1943, (2) Jimmy McGrath 1945-‘46, (9) Phil Fan Larkin 1963-‘64, ‘71-‘75, 1978-‘79, (1) Sean Georgie Leahy 1971, (7) Liam O'Brien 1969, ‘72-‘75, 1978-‘79; (6) Mick Crotty 1972-‘75, 1978-‘79, (2) Eamon Morrissey 1972-‘73, (2) Ned Byrne 1971-‘72, (1) Mick Moore 1973, (6) Brian Cody 1973-‘75, 1978, 1982-‘83, (5) Joe Hennessy 1978-‘79, 1982-‘83, 1986-‘87, (1) Thomas Leahy 1987, (1) Dinny McCormack 1982, (4) Tom McCormack -1974-‘75, 1982-‘83, (1) Billy Walton 1982, (2) Paddy Neary 1982-‘83, (1) Tommy Fogarty 1991, (1) Dermot Grogan 2001, (6) Philip Larkin 1998-‘03, (5) Brian McEvoy 1998-‘02, (7) Peter Barry 1998-‘05, (10) Jackie Tyrrell 2003, ’05-’11, 14-'15, (3) Donnacha Cody 2006-08, (9) Eoin Larkin 2005-’11, 14-'15, (2) Eoin McCormack 2005-‘06, (4) Matthew Ruth 2011-'12, 14-'15, (1) Tomás Keogh 2014, (1) Diarmuid Cody 2015.

First James Stephens player to captain a Kilkenny team

James Holland, captain of Kilkenny Junior Hurling team in 1925 (defeated by Dublin in replay

of Leinster Final on 8 November 1925).

All-Ireland Minor Hurling

Captains of winning teams

Brian Cody 1972, Shane Doyle 1993.

All-Ireland Minor Hurling Medal Winners

Mick Tyrrell 1931, Billy Ayres 1931, Dermot Hughes 1931, John Shortall 1931, Jimmy Morrissey

1931, Paddy Denieffe 1931, (2) Bobby Brannigan 1935-‘36, Jimmy Tierney 1936, Joe

Ayres 1960, Brian Cody 1972, Paddy O'Brien 1972, (2) Seanie O'Brien 1972-‘73, Joe Hennessy

1973, Josie O'Brien 1975, Martin Hennessy 1975, Tony Henderson 1981, Jimmy Conroy

1988, Dominic Bradley 1988, (2) Philip Larkin 1990-‘91, Shane Doyle 1993, Vincent

O’Brien 1993, Liam Smith 1993, Kevin Grogan 1993, Conor Cleere 1993, Donnacha Cody

2003, (2) David McCormack 2002-‘03, Eoin Larkin 2002, Luke Scanlon 22014, Conor Browne 2014.

Captains of Leinster Championship winning teams

Pat Butler 1971, Brian Cody 1972, Shane Doyle 1993, James Tyrrell 2013.

All-Ireland Junior Hurling

Captains of winning teams

Sean Tyrrell 1956

All-Ireland Junior Medal Winners

Kerr McGrath 1928, Paddy Nully Walsh 1928, Michael Bergin 1928, Jack Sag Carroll 1928, Sean Tyrrell 1956, Jimmy Coyne 1956, Jim Florrie McCarthy 1956, Phil Fess Brennan 1956, Peter Fennelly 1956, Dixie Brennan 1956.

All Ireland Intermediate Hurling

Derrick Brennan 2008, Richie Hayes 2010.

Leinster Intermediate Hurling

Derrick Brennan 2007, ‘08, ‘09, Richie Hayes 2010.

All-Ireland U-21 Hurling

Captains of winning teams

Philip Larkin 1994, Jackie Tyrrell 2003.

All-Ireland U-21 Medal Winners

(2) Brian Cody 1974-‘75, Tom McCormack 1974, (2) Joe Hennessy 1975, 1977, Paddy O'Brien 1975, Josie O'Brien 1977, Ger Tyrrell 1977, Tom Leahy 1984, Eddie O’Neill 1984, Jimmy Conroy 1990, Declan Forristal 1990, Peter Barry 1994, Philip Larkin 1994, Brian McEvoy 1994, Francis Cantwell 1994, Tobias White 1994, Malcolm Murphy 1994, Jackie Tyrrell 2003, Eoin McCormack 2003, Eoin Larkin 2004, David McCormack 2006, Donnacha Cody 2006, (2) Matthew Ruth 2006, ‘08.

National Hurling League

Captains of Winning Teams

Phil Fan Larkin 1975/76, Brian Cody 1981/82, Peter Barry 2005, Jackie Tyrrell 2006, Eoin Larkin 2012.

National League Medals

​Paddy Nully Walsh 1932/33, Paddy Larkin 1932/33, Mick Larkin 1932/33, Jack Sag Carroll 1932/33, Martin Gleeson 1932/’33, Phil Fan Larkin 1975/76, (3) Brian Cody 1975/76, 1981/82, 1982/83, Liam Chunky O'Brien 1975/76, Mick Crotty 1975/76, (4) Joe Hennessy 1975/76, 1981/82, 1982/83, 1985/86, (2) Paddy Neary 1981/82, 1982/83, Ned Kelly 1982/83, Billy Walton 1981/82, (2) Tom McCormack 1975/76, 82’/83, Dinny McCormack 1981/82, Dermot Grogan 2002, (2) Philip Larkin 2002, ‘03. (2) Brian McEvoy 2002, ‘03, (3) Peter Barry 2002, ‘03, ‘05, (7) Jackie Tyrrell 2005, ‘06, ‘08, ‘09, ‘12-'14, (2) Donnacha Cody ‘06, ‘08, (6) Eoin Larkin ‘05, ‘06, ‘09, ‘12-'14 (2) Eoin McCormack 2005-06, (3) Matthew Ruth 2012-'14, Tomás Keogh 2014.

Oireachtas SH Finals 1939-99

Paddy Larkin 1940, Mick Tyrrell 1940, Paddy Larkin 1940, Peter Blanchfield 1940,

Mick Taylor 1969, Sean Brennan 1969, Mick Crotty 1969, Liam O'Brien 1969,

Joe Hennessy 1984, Peter Barry 1999.

Interprovincial / Railway Cup Hurling

Captains of Winning Teams

Paddy Larkin 1936, Phil Fan Larkin 1979, Jackie Tyrrell 2012.

Medal Winners

​(3) Paddy Larkin 1932, ‘33, ‘36, Jack Sag Carroll 1932, (2) Mick Phleep Larkin 1932, ‘36, (2) Peter Blanchfield 1936, ‘41, (6) Phil Fan Larkin 1972-‘75,’77, ‘79, (4) Liam Chunky O'Brien 1973-‘75, 1977, Brian Cody 1977, Joe Hennessy 1979, Mick Crotty 1975, Philip Larkin 1998, Brian McEvoy 1998, Peter Barry 1998, (3) Jackie Tyrrell 2006, 2008-09, 2012, (3) Eoin Larkin; 2008-09, ‘12.

Captains of Winning County Senior Hurling Teams

Paddy Larkin 1935,1937, Mick Dunne 1969, Phil Fan Larkin 1975, Liam O' Brien 1976, Jimmy O' Brien 1981, Peter Barry 2004, 2005, Jackie Tyrrell 2011.

Captains of Club All-Ireland Teams

Phil Fan Larkin 1976, Jimmy O' Brien 1982, Peter Barry 2005.

All Star Awards

Since 1971 the National All Star awards in hurling and football have recognised

exceptional talent and performance in Gaelic Games.

Since 2002 James Stephens has led the club roll of honour.

Phil Fan Larkin: 1973, ‘74, ‘76, ‘78

Liam Chunky O’Brien: 1973, ‘74, ‘75, ‘79

Texaco ‘Hurler of the Year’ 1975

Mick Crotty: 1974

Brian Cody: 1975, ‘82

Joe Hennessy: 1978, ‘79, ‘83, ‘84, ‘87

Peter Barry: 1999, 2000, ‘02

Brian McEvoy: 1999

Philip Larkin: 2002

Jackie Tyrrell: 2007, ‘08, ‘09, ‘10

Eoin Larkin: 2008, 2009, Vodafone ‘Hurler of the Year’ 2008,

Gaelic Players Association ‘Hurler of the Year’ 2008

Camogie All Star

Aoife Neary 2008, 2009

All Ireland Colleges senior A hurling

Winning Captain

Jimmy Conroy 1988.

St. Kieran’s College

Mick Moore 1965, Brian Cody 1971, Joe Reidy 1971, (2) Bob Cody Jr. 1988-‘89, Declan Forristal 1988, Dominic Bradley 1988, Billy Whelan 1988, Paul Brennan 1988, Padraig Larkin 1988, (2) Tadhg Donohoe 1988-‘89, (2) Philip Larkin 1989-‘90, Tobias White 1990, (2) Shane Doyle 1992-‘93, Peter Barry 1992, (2) Clive Kenny 1990, 1992, (2) Eugene Somers 1990, 1992, Liam Smith 1992, (2) Vincent O’Brien 1992-‘93, Stephen Drennan 1993, Martin Phelan 1993, Robert Kearney 1993, Michael Fogarty 1996, Tomás Ó Dowd 1996, Derrick Brennan 2000, Jackie Tyrrell 2000, Peter O’Neill 2000, Brendan Doyle 2000, (2) Donnacha Cody 2003-‘04, (2) Patrick Butler 2003, ‘04, (2) Jamie Quane 2003, ‘04, (2) Luke Hickey 2010-’11, (2) Diarmuid Cody 2010-’11, Jack McGrath 2011, (2) Ray Lahart 2014-'15 Conor Browne 2014, (2) Tadhg O'Dwyer 2014-'15 Gavin Costigan 2014, Dylan O'Shea 2014, Conor Byrne 2015, Ben Lawlor 2015, William Spenser 2015, Eamonn Fennelly 2015,

Martin Hennessy, Tom McCormack, Donie Collins (Commercials) 1980

Jimmy O’ Brien (Avonmore) 1983, 1985-‘88 (capt ‘88)

Richie Manogue (Avonmore) 1993,

David McCormack, Ger Flood (Kilkenny Teachers) 2011

Brian Cody 2008, Seamus Pattison 2008.

John Leahy 1951, ‘52
